reviews.review: Wow, this film got me shooked. It was everything I wanted. This is a marvel film that goes into different direction. It was funny, sad, heartbreaking, thrilling and dark. To all the marvel fans that haven't seen this movie yet, go see this film, it's amazing film, and the Russo's brothers did a amazing job in this movie.
Created the account just to rate 5 stars. Its like a roller coaster ride.

This movie exemplifies everything wrong with modern movies and convoluted stupendously stupid and empty plot lines, bad writing, and probably the most boring movie I have endured in three years! Every character's power is conveniently reduced for feeble drama attempts (may work for grade school fans?) and lamely delayed 'power' reveals when they need feeble boosts in the poorly made up story (HULK in Iron Man suit, Thor a pussy for over 2 hours, Vision a mamby pansey baby for entire movie - need I cont?). 
And the pace is slower than infinity, and my friends called it 'Infinity Bore' straightaway. 
Each character is weak both in their all known powers, and intelligence, so we all guessed that the new order of superhero movie writing is simply to add comedic one liners every five minutes in order to make up for this, then lack of climatic potency means now to add caveman dumb drama writing and just kill off characters as needed; certainly a recipie for a disasterous unentertaining mess.
This is one of the worst movies ever made if judged by real substance.
I am positive that all of these superhero and Star Wars movies have now degraded so long now that the sheer fanfare and scale of this flop have fooled many in contrast; evident by it tricking everyone to be anything beyond a 55/100 on RT. And I thought the Transformers movies took movies down so many notches, these almost write themselves (like a Bond film), so f**king it up is almost impossible - almost infinitely so! So-so-so dumb. Tortuously so.

This is a great conclusion of 10 years of MCU's development. But I would like to point that the movie was a bit too short, what I mean by that is that it should have included some more scenes for the characters that were left out a bit and also to explain some transitions between a scene and another. I know that 150 minutes are  a lot, but it is still a really big movie, I just can't be roughly as long as Captain America Civil War. Also,  the Russo Brothers were wrong about a thing (using Avengers Infinity War part 1 and part 2 titles) , this kinda looks like an half completed movie, but only partly. Besides all of this, it definitely is (at least) better than Avengers 2.

This movie is incredible. Never before I exited a movie theater as flabbergasted as I did in this one. My mind literally froze. I couldn't believe what I saw. Avengers Infinity War hits all the right marks and it's a thrill to watch.
Emotional and thrilling. Favorite MCU movie.

Wow, just, wow. Somehow, the Russo Brothers have outdone themselves, again. I was really skeptical on how they would make a high leveled movie featuring so many stars but they do it. A lot obviously going on in this movie but you never feel lost or are left scratching your head. Itâ€™s going to be a long year waiting for Part II, but believe me it will be well worth it!!
very choppy storyline wise lots of action but no meat

This is everything a popcorn film should be. Subverting the audience's expectations in a great way, incredible villain, and a perfect tonal shift from beginning to end of the film. This is the summer blockbuster you have to see!
